question: Female sterilization is absolutely contraindicated in:
exp: There is no absolute medical contraindication for female sterilization. Also remember, : FEMALE STERILIZATION MALE STERILIZATION - Married - Married - 22-49 yrs old female - 22-60 yrs old male - >= 1 child - >= 1 child - No past history in self/ spouse sterilization - No past history in self/ spouse sterilization - MINILAP - Done by trained MBBS/ MD Gyn-obs/ DGO - Conventional vasectomy - Trained MBBS & above - Laproscopic sterilization- MD Gyn-obg /DGO - MS surgery - No scalpel vasectomy - Trained MBBS & above
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Contraindications for Medical aboions are all except:
exp: Age is no contraindication for medical aboion. Contraindications for medical aboions; Hemoglobin less than 8 gm% Undiagnosed adnexal mass Uncontrolled seizure disorder Uncontrolled coagulation disorders etc
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Ideal contraceptive for a couple who are living separately in two cities and meets only occasionally:-
exp: Ideal contraceptive for a couple who are living separately in two cities and meets only occasionally is Condom as long term contraception is not desirable. - Also OCPs and IUCD are required for long term contraception and both of them have few side effects too; so they are not desirable in this case. - Inj. DMPA is an injectable hormonal formulation which given contraception for 3 months which is not desirable here.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: With DMPA, the next injection may be taken latest by:
exp: DMPA is effective for 13 weeks. It has grace period of 4 weeks, which means that this woman can get her next injection before completed 17 weeks. If she comes later than 17 weeks, then she will be given injection but will have to use backup for next 7 days, as injections would take time to become effective.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: The failure rate of TODAY is lowest in:
exp: - Today is a Vaginal sponge. Vaginal sponge It is a small polyurethane foam sponge measuring 5 cm x 2.5 cm, saturated with the spermicide, nonoxynol-9. The failure rate in parous women is between 20-40 per 100 women-years and in nulliparous women about 9-20 per 100 women years. Barrier method - Has a high failure rate; only consistent use for 2 years. - Has advantage of HIV/STI protection but a 'healthy' couple may not need it.
opd: Same in all (Does not depend on parity)
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Which of the following is not true regarding 'no scalpel' vasectomy?
exp: - No scalpel vasectomy(also called keyhole vasectomy or NSV) is a vasectomy procedure variant in which a sharp hemostat is used to puncture the scrotum to access the vas deferens instead of giving an incision as in conventionalvasectomy. - No cuts are made in no-scalpel vasectomy, but the skin is punctured. - The failure rate is same as that of conventional vasectomy. - It is a very popular method in China.
opa: Special instruments are used to deliver the vas instead of cutting the skin
opb: Scrotal skin is cut with LASER to expose the vas
opc: The failure rate is same as that of conventional vasectomy
opd: It is a very popular method in China
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Guidelines for Sterilization includes all except:
exp: Guidelines for sterilization Age of the husband should not be < 25 years nor > 50 years. Age of the wife should not be < 20 years or > 45 years. Motivated couple must have >= 1 living children at the time of Sx. If the couple has >=3 living children, the lower limit of age of the husband/wife may be relaxed at the discretion of the operating surgeon. If the acceptor declares having obtained the consent of his/her spouse to undergo sterilization without outside pressure, inducement or coercion, and that he/she knows that for all practical purposes, the operation is irreversible, and also that the spouse has not been sterilized earlier.
opa: The age of the husband should not ordinarily be less than 25 years nor should it be over 50 years
opb: The age of the wife should not be less than 20 years or more than 45 years.
opc: The motivated couple must have 3 living children at the time of operation.
opd: If the couple has 3 or more living children, the lower limit of age of the husband or wife may be relaxed at the discretion of the operating surgeon
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Laparoscopic sterilization is not recommended during the period of:
exp: - Laparoscopy is not advisable for postpaum patients for 6 weeks following delivery- Hence, option-1 is answer - However, it can be done as a concurrent procedure to MTP. - Haemoglobin should not be less than 8. - It is recommended that the patient be kept in hospital for a minimum of 48 hours after the operation.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: MC side effect of DMPA is:-
exp: MC side effect of DMPA is Disruptions of normal menstrual cycles ( most common) Depot Medroxy Progesterone Acetate ( DMPA) Is a progestogen only Injectable contraceptive ( Depot formulation ) Dose : 150 mg i/m every 3 months Advantage Highly effective Long lasting and reversible Does not affect lactation Side effects: Disruptions of normal menstrual cycles ( most common) Amenorrhea
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Most cost effective family planning method is:-
exp: Sterilization is the most cost-effective contraceptive measure. - Vasectomy is most effective sterilization method than tubectomy. - Cost wise ratio is 5 vasectomies to 1 tubectomy.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: All of the following are eligibility criteria for female sterilization, except:
exp: Atleast one living child should be present. Sterilization New Guidelines 2014: FEMALE STERILIZATION MALE STERILIZATION - Married - Married - 22-49 yrs old female - 22-60 yrs old male - >= 1 living child should be present - >= 1 living child is present - No past history in self/ spouse sterilization - No past history in self/ spouse sterilization - MINILAP - Done by trained MBBS/ MD Gyn-obs/ DGO - Conventional vasectomy - Trained MBBS & above - Laproscopic sterilization- MD Gyn-obg /DGO - MS surgery - No scalpel vasectomy - Trained MBBS & above
opa: Clients age should not be less than 22 years or more than 49 years
opc: Client or her spouse must not have undergone sterilization in the past
opd: At least two living children should be present
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: A man underwent vasectomy, but 6 months later his wife was 16 weeks pregnant. What is the most likely cause?
exp: - Misidentification of Vas deferens by Surgeon is the MCC of Failure in Vasectomy.
opd: Failure to use additional contraception in postoperative period
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: What is used as Emergency contraceptive?
exp: Emergency contraceptives means = Post coital contraceptives 1 MALA - N, Combined OCP's 2 0.75 mg LNG 3 Copper T 4 POP's 5 RU 486 (Mifepristone) 6 High dose Estrogen 7 IUD
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning

question: Following are the contraindication for laparoscopic female sterilization, except-
exp: NOTE THAT THE QUESTION IS ASKING EXCEPT - Of the given options, the least worrisome condition for performing laparoscopic gynecological procedures is hiatal hernia. - Laparoscopy is not advisable for postpaum patients for 6 weeks following delivery. - However, it can be done as a concurrent procedure to MTP. - Haemoglobin percent should not be less than 8. - There should be no associated medical disorders such as hea disease, respiratory disease, diabetes and hypeension. - It is recommended that the patient be kept in hospital for a minimum of 48 hours after the operation.
topic_name: Other FP Methods and New Initiatives in Family Planning
